com.ebay.redlasersdk
Class BarcodeScanActivity

java.lang.Object
  android.content.Context
      android.content.ContextWrapper
          android.view.ContextThemeWrapper
              android.app.Activity
                  com.ebay.redlasersdk.BarcodeScanActivity
All Implemented Interfaces:
android.content.ComponentCallbacks, android.content.ComponentCallbacks2, android.view.KeyEvent.Callback, android.view.LayoutInflater.Factory, android.view.LayoutInflater.Factory2, android.view.View.OnCreateContextMenuListener, android.view.Window.Callback
public abstract class BarcodeScanActivity
extends android.app.Activity

Base barcode activity. Intended to be subclassed by client apps to implement the scanning activity. Most of the public API for the SDK is either handled or indirectly managed by this class.

Set scan screen orientation to landscape

See Also:
Constant Field Values

RESULT_EXTRA

public static final java.lang.String RESULT_EXTRA
An ArrayList of everything found in the scan session, returned as extra data in the return Intent when the scanning activity completes.

See Also:
Constant Field Values

REDLASER_CAMERA_PREVIEW_VIEW_TAG

public static final java.lang.String REDLASER_CAMERA_PREVIEW_VIEW_TAG
Used to tag a particular view in a hierarchy to be the container for the camera preview. Applications should subclass BarcodeScanActivity and set up a scan overlay (by calling setContentView()) in their onCreate() method. Applications can optionally tag a view with this constant, and the SDK will set up the camera preview as a subview of the tagged view.

If no view is tagged, and getPreviewView() isn't implemented or returns null, the camera preview is created as a fullscreen view behind the rest of the content.

Using this tag is one way to achieve a non-fullscreen camera preview.

See Also:
getPreviewView(), Constant Field Values

enabledTypes

public BarcodeTypes enabledTypes
The set of enabled barcode types. The SDK will only attempt to recognize the barcode types enabled in this object. You can, if necessary, change this value during a scan session.

Constructor Detail

BarcodeScanActivity

public BarcodeScanActivity()
Default constructor. A few properties need to be initialized here so that they can be modified by subclasses in onCreate--particularly if they modify the property and *then* call super().

onConfigurationChanged

public void onConfigurationChanged(android.content.res.Configuration config)
Called by android.app.Activity on when the device configuration changes. BarcodeScanActivity overrides this method to prevent reloading the activity when the orientation changes or the keyboard is shown or hidden. Remember that your application must add a "configChanges" attribute to the scan activity in the manifest for this to work.

Specified by:
onConfigurationChanged in interface android.content.ComponentCallbacks
Overrides:
onConfigurationChanged in class android.app.Activity

enabledBarcodeTypesChanged

protected void enabledBarcodeTypesChanged()
Called automatically when the set of enabled barcode types changes. You shouldn't need to call this method yourself.

doneScanning

protected void doneScanning()
This method ends the scan session. Generally called by the status method in subclasses, or in a subclass button handler.

onBackPressed

public void onBackPressed()
The SDK forwards onBackPressed to doneScanning(). DoneScanning() calls finish(), but also sets the result to RESULT_OK and parcels up the found barcodes.

Overrides:
onBackPressed in class android.app.Activity

requestCameraIndex

protected void requestCameraIndex(int index)
Request a specific camera by index. The index is bounds-checked and used in the Camera.open(int) call. Does not guarantee that this camera index will be used. If the requested camera is unsuitable, fails to open, or the API level is < 9, the default camera may be opened instead. Currently, the camera index must be set before onStart() occurs, and the camera can't be changed once scanning starts.

Parameters:
index - The camera to use. 0 is the default.

setActiveRect

protected void setActiveRect(android.graphics.Rect activeRect)
Sets the given rect as the engine's active rect. This function takes a rectangle in the preview coordinate system, and will use additional effort to try to find barcodes within that area.

Parameters:
activeRect - The rectangle to set, in preview coords

requestImageData

protected void requestImageData()
Calling this method during a scan session will make the SDK asynchronously gather image data and deliver it in a call to onScanStatusUpdate()--often but not always the next call. The image data will be returned in the STATUS_CAMERA_SNAPSHOT key of the HashMap parameter.

The SDK may return JPEG-compressed image data from the preview stream, or it may use the Camera's picture-taking methods to acquire JPEG data. In either case, this method is not fast enough to deliver a constant stream of preview images.

setTorch

protected void setTorch(boolean torchValue)
Turns the camera light on during preview.

Parameters:
torchValue - TRUE to turn torch on.

getTorch

protected boolean getTorch()
Returns the current state of the camera torch.

isTorchAvailable

protected boolean isTorchAvailable()
Returns whether torch mode is available. Specifically, returns TRUE if the Camera device that was opened has FLASH_MODE_TORCH in its list of supported flash modes.

This method will only return valid results after the Activity's onResume() method has been called. Remember that the camera that gets opened is not necessarily the camera that was requested.

The intent of this method is to allow the application to have a 'Light' button that only appears on devices with torch mode.

onTouchEvent

public boolean onTouchEvent(android.view.MotionEvent event)
Called by android.app.Activity when a touch event occurs that isn't handled by any view (such as a button). On devices that support focusing areas, a tap in the camera preview area will initiate a focus on the indicated point. On devices that support autofocus but not focusing areas, an autofocus will be initiated.

Your application can override this method in your BarcodeScanActivity subclass if you want taps in the preview area to perform some other action.

Overrides:
onTouchEvent in class android.app.Activity

onCameraPreviewStarted

public void onCameraPreviewStarted()
Performs some setup when the camera starts delivering preview images. Do not call this method directly.

onCameraError

public void onCameraError(int error)
Used to propagate camera errors to the onError method (onError is protected). Do not call this method directly.

onError

protected void onError(int error)
Intended to be overridden by subclasses. This method may be overridden by subclasses to be informed of errors that occur while scanning.

onScanStatusUpdate

protected abstract void onScanStatusUpdate(java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Object> scanStatus)
This method is called repeatedly while scanning is active. The scanStatus map contains status information about the scanning session.

Parameters:
scanStatus -

getOrientationSetting

public java.lang.String getOrientationSetting()
Override this method to request a screen orientation programmatically. Default orientation is portrait.

The BarcodeScanActivity calls this method during onCreate(). Your subclass, therefore, should ensure that this method returns the proper value before your subclass calls super.onCreate().

Returns:
Either PREF_ORIENTATION_LANDSCAPE or PREF_ORIENTATION_PORTRAIT.

getPreviewView

protected android.widget.FrameLayout getPreviewView()
Subclasses can override this method to indicate to the BarcodeScanActivity where in the view hierarchy the camera preview view should be placed. If this method is not implemented, the camera preview will be added as a child of the root view, behind all other views, sized to the size of the screen.
